com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware

Interface ColorSensor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HardwareDevice
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AMSColorSensor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdafruitI2cColorSensor, AMSColorSensorImpl, HiTechnicNxtColorSensor, ModernRoboticsI2cColorSensor

    public interface ColorSensor
extends HardwareDevice
    Represents a sensor that can separately measure red, green, blue, and white light intensities

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareDevice

        HardwareDevice.Manufacturer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int alpha()
      Gets the white value read by the sensor (scale depends on the sort of color sensor)
      int argb()
      Gets a integer whose bits specify all four channels' current intensities
      int blue()
      Gets the blue value read by the sensor (scale depends on the sort of color sensor)
      void enableLed(boolean enable)
      Turns on or off the sensor's light (to switch between measuring ambient or reflected light)
      I2cAddr getI2cAddress()
      Get the current I2C Address of this object.
      int green()
      Gets the green value read by the sensor (scale depends on the sort of color sensor)
      int red()
      Gets the red value read by the sensor (scale depends on the sort of color sensor)
      void setI2cAddress(I2cAddr newAddress)
      Changes the I2C address that the sensor responds on.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareDevice

        close, getConnectionInfo, getDeviceName, getManufacturer, getVersion, resetDeviceConfigurationForOpMode

    • Method Detail

      • red

        int red()
        Gets the red value read by the sensor (scale depends on the sort of color sensor)
        Returns:
        a number proportional to the intensity of red light measured by the sensor

      • green

        int green()
        Gets the green value read by the sensor (scale depends on the sort of color sensor)
        Returns:
        a number proportional to the intensity of green light measured by the sensor

      • blue

        int blue()
        Gets the blue value read by the sensor (scale depends on the sort of color sensor)
        Returns:
        a number proportional to the intensity of blue light measured by the sensor

      • alpha

        int alpha()
        Gets the white value read by the sensor (scale depends on the sort of color sensor)
        Returns:
        a number proportional to the intensity of light measured by the sensor

      • argb

        int argb()
        Gets a integer whose bits specify all four channels' current intensities
        Returns:
        an sRGB color with the specified combined RGBA value consisting of the white component in bits 24-31, the red component in bits 16-23, the green component in bits 8-15, and the blue component in bits 0-7

      • enableLed

        void enableLed(boolean enable)
        Turns on or off the sensor's light (to switch between measuring ambient or reflected light)
        Parameters:
        enable - true will turn on the LED, and false will turn it off

      • setI2cAddress

        void setI2cAddress(I2cAddr newAddress)
        Changes the I2C address that the sensor responds on. This only works for the Modern Robotics sensor. The sensor will keep its new address (even on loss of power) until it is set to a different value.
        Parameters:
        newAddress - the new address; the 8-bit value must be a multiple of 2 between 16 and 126, inclusive
        See Also:
        ModernRoboticsI2cColorSensor

      • getI2cAddress

        I2cAddr getI2cAddress()
        Get the current I2C Address of this object. Not necessarily the same as the I2C address of the actual device. Return the current I2C address.
        Returns:
        current I2C address
